newsitem.title: THAILAND: Three groups seek to revive ailing Thai bank.
newsitem.headline: Three groups seek to revive ailing Thai bank.

text.p: Three private investor groups on Tuesday submitted proposals to revive ailing Bangkok Bank of Commerce Plc in exchange for its Thai bank licence.

Bangkok Bank of Commerce spokesman Viravudh Vacharapai said investors, led separately by Nithipat Capital Plc, SITCA Investment and Securities Plc, and Black Forrest Holding Corp, applied to rehabilitate the bank after it was placed under administration by a government-appointed panel in May.
He declined to detail proposals of the three groups or identify parties involved.
Bangkok Bank of Commerce has been suspended since May when the central bank said it was saddled with over 70 billion baht ($2.75 billion) of risky and non-performing loans.
Viravudh said the finance ministry and the Bank of Thailand were expected to make an initial choice on a successful bidder for further negotiations in early November.
Bangkok Bank of Commerce was bailed out earlier this year after disclosure of its loan problems by opposition politicians in parliament triggered a heavy public run on its deposits.
